reasoning: Hereditary renal hypouricemia caused by urate transporter defects (URAT1, GLUT9 mutations). Estimated incidence 0.5-1.0 per 100k based on genetic disorder frequency. Type 1 more common in Asian populations. Low confidence due to limited global epidemiological data; most information from genetic studies and case series.
source: Enomoto A et al. (2002). Molecular identification of a renal urate anion exchanger that regulates blood urate levels. Nature. 417(6888):447-452
